metadata.title: Distribution Patterns of Urea in the Bering Sea and its Role in the Nitrogen Cycle
metadata.description:
Urea determination data along 5 sections in the Bering Sea perpendicular to
        the coastline show that the distribution of urea is similar to that of ammonium
        nitrogen. Accumulation of urea and ammonium was generally observed under
        the thermocline but the absolute concentration of urea was slightly higher. With
        the total urea and ammonium content of 7-10 mu g-at N/l in the euphotic
        layer, 8-10g C/m super(2) organic matter per day may be produced in the
        process of photosynthesis due to nitrogen recycling.
metadata.notes:
Purpose: To report on the distribution patterns of urea in the Bering Sea and its role in the nitrogen cycle.

Status: Complete

Maintenance frequency: None Planned
